intro: Cephaelis bicoloriceps, commonly known as the two-colored head plant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its strikingly colorful flowers, which typically display a combination of red and white hues. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture. Cephaelis bicoloriceps is appreciated in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
